body:
Which FTP server is this?

I'm going to need to replicate this to fix it, any suggestions?

It's one used by my ISP ( ftp://storage.rcs-rds.ro/ ). 
I think they use some 'home made' server. I will try to find out exactly what they use.
Is there a way to find out what they use? (some linux commands, for ex?)

Yes it does look home made!

```
$ telnet storage.rcs-rds.ro ftp
220 Digi Storage FTP 1.0
```

BTW I note they support webdav too: https://storage.rcs-rds.ro/help/webdav (well maybe - I can't read what it says on the page!) and rclone has a [webdav backend](https://rclone.org/webdav/)

> $ telnet storage.rcs-rds.ro ftp
> 220 Digi Storage FTP 1.0

Oh, I got this too, I just wasn't 100% sure it is the server info.

I will open a ticket with them too, maybe they can tell me the server they used to make their own.

If not, I will have to use webdav. I have before...

BTW, filezilla doesn't have this issue.

> BTW, filezilla doesn't have this issue.

FileZilla is a very clever bit of software with lots of workarounds for odd FTP servers!

BTW It might be worth trying [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) as I updated the FTP library to latest in it.  I didn't check the changelog so there might be no difference.

No, sadly the issue is still there...

I did try the webdav, but it seems there are issues with that too, it copied everything almost twice, after that I did another copy via FTP and it copied only the new files. 
I even tried webdav with --ignore-existing, but that didn't work either...

@easy90rider is there any chance you could get me a login to this FTP server? Or maybe I could borrow yours for a short while?  Email me at nick@craig-wood.com if you think that would be possible (put a link to this issue in the email so I have some context) - thanks.

@ncw the support from the ISP / provider called me and they promised that they will send a test user. 
As soon as I have that I will send it to you.

I am seeing this issue too possibly with a custom FTP server.
I can provide some test login credentials if this would help diagnose the issue?

Thanks,
Thanks very much for this - look forward to testing and will report back!

You are a life saver!

I had to use/used to use freefilesync to sync with the FTP server, it takes 10-30x more time to sync with that than it does with rclone! 

I tested and it worked. Actually I had some files that weren't synced to the FTP server, because of this bug, but now they are!

Thank you!
